cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 525 mi SSE of Bermuda and 1170 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then turning northwest mid-week while accelerating toward the North and South Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North Carolina or extreme northern South Carolina

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts expected along the North and South Carolina coasts, with effects spreading into Virginia and the Mid-Atlantic interior.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (<= 34 kt) are possible late Friday into Saturday if the inland remnants track near the Delaware Valley.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge (1–2 ft) possible in the Delaware River during strong on-shore flow, but not expected to exceed 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands associated with Florence’s remnants could produce 4–6 inches and localized flooding across southern New Jersey and the Delaware Valley.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Fresh-water river flooding and possible brief tornadoes in spiral rain bands could disrupt terminal and rail operations.
